result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark T Haka

records.addlTxt:
10:55 AM Defendant Mark T Haka not in court.  Attorney Blake Duren appeared by video for Mark T Haka.  Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Duren was informed that his client is in Waushara County Jail for 2 months.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Atty Duren to coordinate with JA to set up zoom.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on November 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: *No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

3:24 PM Defendant Mark T Haka appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Mark Gumz appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant does qualify for PD appointment; asks for an IA to be set.
Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 

Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
Initial appearance scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
